Hi, Thanks for writing in. Achalasia is a condition where the lower esophageal sphincter is not able to open to allow food to pass into the stomach. The food gets collected in the esophagus and the person feels a lot of pain in the chest and is not able to take in food. The treatment of achalasia is by performing a procedure called as a Heller's procedure where the lower esophageal sphincter is cut and the person is able to take in food. The other treatment is by performing a balloon dilatation where a balloon is passed through a tube in the mouth and the lower esophageal sphincter is dilated. This is a temporary measure and has to be repeated at regular intervals. Please do
